qas.question: What do historians credit with revitalizing Greek culture?
The evolution of Grecian culture has evolved over what time period?

context: The culture of Greece has evolved over <a2_0>thousands of years<a2_0/>, beginning in <a0_0>Mycenaean Greece<a0_0/> and continuing most notably into Classical Greece, through the influence of the Roman Empire and its Greek Eastern continuation, the Eastern Roman or Byzantine Empire. Other cultures and nations, such as the Latin and Frankish states, the Ottoman Empire, the Venetian Republic, the Genoese Republic, and the British Empire have also left their influence on modern Greek culture, although historians credit the <a1_0>Greek War of Independence<a1_0/> with revitalising Greece and giving birth to a single, cohesive entity of its multi-faceted culture.
